Package utils

Class FileUtils

java.lang.Object
utils.FileUtils
public class FileUtils
extends java.lang.Object
A class with some utility functions for Files

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructor Description
    FileUtils()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static char getMergeFileType​(java.lang.String filename)
    Returns the type of merge required for a specified File

    Transfers data between Streams using a buffer, so that RAM usage stays low.
    static void transfer​(java.io.FileInputStream fis, java.io.FileOutputStream fos, long partLength, int maxBufferLength)
    Transfers data between Streams using a buffer, so that RAM usage stays low

    Verifies if a filename is in the pattern of .[de]part001

  • Constructor Details

    • FileUtils

      public FileUtils()

  • Method Details

    • verifyMergeFilename

      public static boolean verifyMergeFilename​(java.lang.String filename)
      Verifies if a filename is in the pattern of .[de]part001
      Parameters:
      filename - The filename
      Returns:
      true if the filename matches the pattern, false otherwise

    • getMergeFileType

      public static char getMergeFileType​(java.lang.String filename)
      Returns the type of merge required for a specified File
      Parameters:
      filename - The filename
      Returns:
      0 if the file isn't mergeable, d if it's just split and e if it is also encrypted.

    • transfer

      public static void transfer​(java.io.FileInputStream fis, java.io.FileOutputStream fos, long partLength) throws java.io.IOException
      Transfers data between Streams using a buffer, so that RAM usage stays low. The maximum buffer length is 1MB
      Parameters:
      fis - The FileInputStream
      fos - The FileOutputStream
      partLength - The size of the chunk of data
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • transfer

      public static void transfer​(java.io.FileInputStream fis, java.io.FileOutputStream fos, long partLength, int maxBufferLength) throws java.io.IOException
      Transfers data between Streams using a buffer, so that RAM usage stays low
      Parameters:
      fis - The FileInputStream
      fos - The FileOutputStream
      partLength - The size of the chunk of data
      maxBufferLength - The maximum size of the buffer -- by default, 1MB
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
